## Description {#details}

Contexts are execution states for the core LLVM IR system.

Most types are tied to a context instance. Multiple contexts can exist simultaneously. A single context is not thread safe. However, different contexts can execute on different threads simultaneously.

<SectionDefinition>

## Functions

### LLVMContextCreate() {#gaac4f39a2d0b9735e64ac7681ab543b4c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="LLVMContextRef LLVMContextCreate (void)">
Create a new context.

Every call to this function should be paired with a call to <a href="#ga9cf8b0fb4a546d4cdb6f64b8055f5f57">LLVMContextDispose()</a> or the context will leak memory.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h/#l00576">576</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h">Core.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp/#l00100">100</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp">Core.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### LLVMContextDispose() {#ga9cf8b0fb4a546d4cdb6f64b8055f5f57}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LLVMContextDispose (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga9c43e01525516ff6b4feab5166c5b1da">LLVMContextRef</a> C)</>}>
Destroy a context instance.

This should be called for every call to <a href="#gaac4f39a2d0b9735e64ac7681ab543b4c">LLVMContextCreate()</a> or memory will be leaked.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h/#l00631">631</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h">Core.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp/#l00139">139</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp">Core.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### LLVMContextSetDiscardValueNames() {#ga0a07c702a2d8d2dedfe0a4813a0e0fd1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LLVMContextSetDiscardValueNames (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga9c43e01525516ff6b4feab5166c5b1da">LLVMContextRef</a> C, <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga209de0bceb13179a973c6a45211617bd">LLVMBool</a> Discard)</>}>
Set whether the given context discards all value names.

If true, only the names of GlobalValue objects will be available in the IR. This can be used to save memory and runtime, especially in release mode.


<SectionUser title="See Also">
LLVMContext::setDiscardValueNames()
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h/#l00623">623</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h">Core.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp/#l00135">135</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp">Core.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### LLVMCreateConstantRangeAttribute() {#ga9c30325536839609a6764bd4921f00fa}

<MemberDefinition

LowerWords and UpperWords need to be NumBits divided by 64 rounded up elements long.

### LLVMGetEnumAttributeKindForName() {#ga4bd62e3a1b94b92e32d892c8f89dea1c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned LLVMGetEnumAttributeKindForName (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42; Name, size&#95;t SLen)</>}>
Return an unique id given the name of a enum attribute, or 0 if no attribute by that name exists.

See <a href="http://llvm.org/docs/LangRef.html#parameter-attributes">http://llvm.org/docs/LangRef.html#parameter-attributes</a> and <a href="http://llvm.org/docs/LangRef.html#function-attributes">http://llvm.org/docs/LangRef.html#function-attributes</a> for the list of available attributes.

NB: Attribute names and/or id are subject to change without going through the C API deprecation cycle.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h/#l00668">668</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h">Core.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp/#l00156">156</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp">Core.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
